author: anmenaga
body: Some tests for New-WinEvent that bring code coverage of the class to 80%.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
Based on the code coverage, you're missing some tests:
https://codecov.io/gh/PowerShell/PowerShell/src/9e41c647a9407e05d86f4971a6bd25719a7130d0/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.Eventing/DotNetCode/Eventing/EventDescriptor.cs
- [ ] EventDescriptor constructor validation like: [System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor]::new(-1, 0, 0, 0, 0, -1, 0)
- [ ] Reading back members of EventDescriptor
https://codecov.io/gh/PowerShell/PowerShell/src/9e41c647a9407e05d86f4971a6bd25719a7130d0/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.Eventing/DotNetCode/Eventing/EventProvider.cs
- [ ] Dispose(), Close(), destructor
- [ ] IsEnabled()
- [ ] different data types
- [ ] WriteMessagEvent()
- [ ] WriteEvent
- [ ] WriteTransferEvent
https://codecov.io/gh/PowerShell/PowerShell/src/9e41c647a9407e05d86f4971a6bd25719a7130d0/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreCLR.Eventing/DotNetCode/Eventing/EventProviderTraceListener.cs
- [ ] EventProviderTraceListener

The Reader code should probably be a different PR

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT All of the things that you've mentioned is ETW code and will go into separate PR.
This PR is specific to New-WinEvent cmdlet code.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @iSazonov  Can you have a look again?

title: Tests for New-WinEvent
